assigned_task:
You have just received an email from your English-speaking friend, Jo.
From: Jo
Hi,
You know I’ve joined my local swimming team – well, I love it! We train every Tuesday and Thursday after school. Now my parents want me to go to an extra maths class on Tuesdays, so I won’t be able to swim then.
How do you think I can persuade them to change their minds?
Write soon,
Jo
Write your email.
task_answer:
Hi Jo,
It is good to receive news from you! I bet you are swimming like a fish. Do you remember when we were kids and we made a few races in Angelina’s pool?
I understand why you are trying to persuade them but remember that they want your best. If I were you, firstly I would try to talk with your swimming coach and ask him about the possibilities of training another day. Then if the answer is negative, I would try to do the same with your future math teacher. I am sure that everyone knows the importance of practising sports while studying, so they will find a solution.
If everything doesn’t happen as you and I expect, ensure that your parents don’t get mad with your decision. They are giving their best! Put your education in first place. Opportunities to swim you will have a lot during your life. Moreover, you can come to Barcelona and try to catch me in the pool.
Good luck,
Sam

ai_answer.feedback: All of the content is relevant to the task. The question in the input has been answered in detail, and the target reader is fully informed.

Although the style is slightly formal in places, the conventions of the email genre have been used effectively to hold the target reader’s attention and communicate straightforward ideas: Hi Jo; I bet you are swimming like a fish; Do you remember when; I understand why; If I were you; you can come to Barcelona and try to catch me in the pool; Good luck.

The text is generally well organised and coherent, using a variety of linking words and cohesive devices: talk with your swimming coach and ask him; Then; if the answer is negative; do the same; so; Moreover.

A range of everyday vocabulary is used appropriately, with occasional inappropriate use of less common lexis: swimming like a fish; kids; made a few races; pool; they want your best; coach; find a solution; ensure; giving their best; catch me. A range of simple and some complex grammatical forms has been used with a good degree of control: I understand … best; If I were you … another day; I am sure … solution; If everything … decision; Opportunities … your life. The errors do not impede communication: if the answer would have been negative I will try; yours; Opportunities to swim you will have.
